description.narrative: The project aims to strengthen FCA’s partner organisations’ participation in global human right processes and involvement in global advocacy work. The objective is to encourage and facilitate FCA’s partner organisations to participate in internation al human right processes such as the Universal Periodic Review (UPR) and other HR Treaty mechanisms of their countries under review, or other global advocacy processes relevant to FCA strategic themes; To contribute raising topical advocacy messages e.g. o f post-MDG objectives through partner networks and global alliances. The partner organisations will organise collection of data, stakeholder meetings and hearings as part of the preparatory process for UPR review of the given country. The UPR review wi ll consist of three key documents: a national report, a compilation of report gathered by OHCHR and a summary of the stakeholders submissions (CSOs, NGOs, academia), prepared by OHCHR. In addition, other global advocacy activities based on FCA global strat egic advocacy objectives will be defined later.Right- holders /beneficiaries: Civil society and the stakeholders they represent, the people the partner organisation is working with, and on global advocacy: all people. Implementing partner: There will be s everal partners as this project is targeted to support FCA’s partner organisations for their possible participation in international human right processes relevant to their country, especially the coming Universal Period Reviews of Nepal and Myanmar in 2 015, other topical UN Human Right Conventions periodic reporting, e.g. on CEDAW and CESCR of FCA programme countries, as well as other global advocacy initiatives under FCA strategic themes.
